message: I think it shows some really cool features supported by Emacs 24 out of the box
I 've read http://www.viget.com/extend/emacs-24-rails-development-environment-from-scratch-to-productive-in-5-minu/ today and I 'm thinking on adopting for python development
Also didn't know about el-get for some reason
(adopting and adapting)
Also check out zpinter's .emacs config system: https://github.com/zpinter/emacs.d
it provides a very nice framework for easily managing, tweaking, activating somewhat 'sandboxed' elisp extensions
also, keeping one's emacs config in git makes replicating one's dev environment much easier
Cool, I 'll check that out as well.
What I liked from what I posted is that it seems to me that I can keep only my init.el in a repo and I 'll be done.
I've been running nightlies of Emacs, and thus 24, for a while now. I do Python development all day.
Just giving a thumbs up, I guess.
I've been running 24 for ~1-2 months.
Its good. I did it to try to remove some things from my emacs config. I pared it down to only needing magit, for now.
Anyone using http://emacs.naquadah.org/ for Ubuntu or just compiling from source?

I compile from sources for Ubuntu. I would not say that this is better than using a package, it's just the way I've always done it.  However, bzr-emacs tends to contain fatal errors which are fixed minutes/hours later, so it is important to be able to a) go back to a previous version and/or b) get further updates quickly.
Since we 're talking on build issues, currently the brew installable method that the article I posted proposes fails. You 'll have to comment out the patch with brew edit.
You could also use the following patch if you want fullscreen-mode, this is an updated patch that applies (at least it did yesterday) https://github.com/downloads/hh/emacs/feature-fullscreen.patch
Cool I 'll check that out.
@alfborge This seems to work only on Macs.

Yeah I only got Macs and the article was for a Mac. On my Ubuntu servers I don't need all the fancy features just some basic editing. But for e.g. Ubuntu you can find the latest Emacs in http://emacs.naquadah.org/
@justinlilly, me too.
I have been using emacs24 for almost a month and I like it I use python but the integration with rope and autocomplete is the feature that I am looking for. Help...

@rwagasore This is what I 'm also working out + I need it to work with virtualenvs

I got it working
where Emacs will virtualenv I'm working on and activate automatically, setting the appropriate path for the automatic linters as well to not get confused about linting

Hey! python in emacs24 function python-mode-map is not defined and I want to map a key to python mode help!
@alfborge: I have to say, that fullscreen patch is changing my life. recompiled on all machines

anyone tried to install emacs24 from source on snow leopard. Tried the link here http://www.viget.com/extend/emacs-24-rails-development-environment-from-scratch-to-productive-in-5-minu/. seem that it does not work now since it is using autoconf
@undefined I did. The only problem I faced was the fullscreen patch which I replaced with one I 've got from convore emacs. Now I cannot live without emacs 24
@soulofpeace you need to run "./autogen/copy_autogen" before running "./configure --with-ns" from the root of the source directory to get it to work.
@aalotia Thanks now everything is working fine
